One day, Mia lost her diary. She looked everywhere but could not find it. Mia was very sad. She prayed that she would find her diary soon.
The next day, Mia's little brother, Sam, found the diary. But it was not the same diary. This diary was magic! When Mia wrote in it, her wishes came true. Mia was very happy and shared her magic diary with Sam. They had lots of fun together.

looked at Tim and said, "I am here to help you find a surprise." Tim was very excited. He picked up the rake and started to look around. The cat followed him as they looked for the surprise.
As Tim and the cat looked around, they found a big box. Tim used the rake to open it. Inside, they found a lot of toys and a note. The note said, "These toys are for you and your new friend." Tim was very happy and thanked the furry cat. They played with the toys all day and became best friends.

"Hi, Billy!" said Sally. "I have a surprise for you!" Billy was excited. He loved surprises. Sally gave him a big, round, spinning toy. Billy played with the toy and started to feel dizzy. He laughed and said, "Sally, this toy makes me dizzy!"

Once upon a time, there was a navy boat. The boat was very busy. It went up and down on the water all day.
One day, the boat had to decide where to go. It could go left or it could go right. The boat thought and thought.
The boat decided to go right. But it was a bad choice. The water was too rough. The busy navy boat tipped over and sank. The end.

little boy named Tim went on an adventurous trip with his mom and dad. They went to see a big steam train. Tim was very excited. He had never seen a steam train before. The train was big, and it made a lot of noise. It went "Choo Choo!" as it moved on the tracks.
Tim's dad said, "Look, Tim! The steam comes out of the train when it moves. Isn't that cool?" Tim nodded and smiled. He was so happy to see the train. He wanted to ride on the train and go on an adventure.

She showed Bobby a very rare stamp that she had. Bobby's eyes nearly popped out of his head and he said he wished he had such a stamp. The old woman said he could have it and Bobby smiled so much in delight. 
When Bobby raced home and showed his parents, they were so angry. They said that he shouldn't have taken it and they didn't want him to be independent like that. Bobby was so sad, he thought he had done something good, but he hadn't.
